squared.game

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • squared.game.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Model class contains all useful variable that can be use during game. Contains all algorithms used in game. Morover there are methods that are responsible for handling square's actions.
    Author:
    bartl_000

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Model.Color
      Used to differentiate colors with unique name and Id.

      • setColorAmount

        public void setColorAmount(int colorAmount)
        Sets how many colors there will be in a game.
        Parameters:

        Gets current score.
        Returns:
        current score

      • setScore

        public void setScore(long value)
        Sets score to a given value.
        Parameters:
        value - long type value, should be positive

      • resetGreySquaresArray

        public void resetGreySquaresArray()
        Creates new GreySquareArray which has maximal size and holds all squares.

      • getSquareArray

        public View.Square[][] getSquareArray()
        Gets squareArray.
        Returns:
        squareArray, if it is empty returns null

        Sets firstClicked to a value given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        firstClicked -

      • setSquareArray

        public void setSquareArray(View.Square[][] square)
        Sets squareArray to a value given as a parameter and adds 3 random squares to the board.
        Parameters:
        square -
        See Also:
        #addRandomSquares(int)}

      • handleClick

        public void handleClick(View.Square handledSquare)
        Sets firstClicked or secondClicked. If secondClicked then looks for path.If path was found move squares and looks for lines. If path was not found adds 3 random squares.
        Parameters:
        handledSquare - square that was clicked
        See Also:
        #findPath(Integer, Integer)}, #moveSquare(Square, Square)}, #lookForStraightLines(int, int)}, #lookForDiagonalLines(int, int, Color)}, #addRandomSquares(int)}

      • findPath

        private boolean findPath(java.lang.Integer x,
                         java.lang.Integer y)
        Recursive method looks for path between firstClicked and secondClicked.
        Parameters:
        x - with first use its x coordinate of firstClicked
        y - with first use its x coordinate of secondClicked
        Returns:
        true if path was found, false otherwise

      • moveSquare

        private void moveSquare(View.Square firstClicked,
                        View.Square secondClicked)
        Moves colors between first and second clicked squares.
        Parameters:
        firstClicked - first clicked square
        secondClicked - second clicked square
        See Also:
        View.Square#setColor(Color)}

      • addRandomSquares

        private void addRandomSquares(int counter)
        Adds random squares to the board. If board is full then updates leaderboard. Additionally looks for straight and diagonal lines.
        Parameters:
        counter - how many squares add
        See Also:
        HighscoreMenager#addHighscore(long, String)}, #lookForStraightLines(int, int)}, #lookForDiagonalLines(int, int, Color)}

      • lookForStraightLines

        private boolean lookForStraightLines(int squareX,
                                     int squareY)
        Looks for squares in straight line vertically and horizontally. If line was found removes that colored squares from board.
        Parameters:
        squareX - x coordinate of a square
        squareY - y coordinate of a square
        Returns:
        true if line was found, false otherwise
        See Also:
        #removeLine(ArrayList)

      • lookForDiagonalLines

        private boolean lookForDiagonalLines(int squareX,
                                     int squareY,
                                     Model.Color color)
        Looks for squares in diagonal lines. If line was found removes that colored squares from board.
        Parameters:
        squareX - x coordinate of a square
        squareY - y coordinate of a square
        color - color of the square
        Returns:
        true if line was found, false otherwise
        See Also:
        #removeLine(ArrayList)

      • removeLine

        private void removeLine(java.util.ArrayList<View.Square> list)
        Removes given squares from the board, sets their color to grey. Adds point to score.
        Parameters:
        list - list of squares that has to be removed

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Resets board, greySquaresArray, sets first and second clicked square to null. Updates leaderboard and adds random squares.
        See Also:
        #resetGreySquaresArray()}, HighscoreMenager#addHighscore(long, String)}, #setScore(long)}, #addRandomSquares(int)}
